title: Synthetic Recap
body:
BOSTON – On a night where legends were born and history was written, Shaquille O’Neal delivered a performance for the ages. The Orlando Magic, carried on the broad shoulders of their colossal center, outlasted the Boston Celtics 121-117 in a thrilling shootout.

The story begins and ends with Shaq. Dominating the painted area with a force rarely seen, O’Neal poured in a staggering 45 points, a herculean effort that left the Celtics defense scrambling for answers. He was not merely scoring; he was an unstoppable force of nature, converting at the rim with thunderous authority and drawing fouls at a relentless pace. His 11 made free throws were a testament to the sheer volume of punishment he absorbed and dished out in the lane.

While Anfernee Hardaway’s brilliant all-around line of 20 points, 14 assists, and 9 rebounds was crucial, and Dana Barros countered with a spectacular 40-point outburst for the Celtics, this was O’Neal’s canvas. Every possession ran through him, every Celtics run was answered by his immovable presence in the post.

In the final, frantic minutes, with the game hanging in the balance, it was Shaq who steadied the ship. His sheer dominance inside created opportunities elsewhere and forced Boston into desperate measures. When the final horn sounded, the scoreboard told the tale of a team victory, but the stat sheet told the legend of one man’s historic night—a 45-point masterpiece from Shaquille O’Neal that carved a path through the Boston Garden.
